intro: Taimingasa yatabei var. yatabei, commonly known as the Yatabei taimingasa, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and streamside areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are slender and erect. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
